episode_event_ch0357_00_suguri/4001_1101:
This is a story about Carmine and Kieran’s
early days on Pasio...
episode_event_ch0357_00_suguri/4001_1001:
Let me introduce you to my friends Carmine
and Kieran!

They’re students from Blueberry Academy—
and they’re siblings, too! We became friends
on a school trip.
I’m Kieran. Nice to meet you.

They just got to Pasio, so I was just showing
them around!

If you two were already here, why didn’t
you come see me sooner?

When I heard you’d arrived, I looked all over
for you!

This is Pasio Academy? It’s nothing special
compared to Blueberry Academy.

Sorry my sis is so rude... She doesn’t mean
to offend anyone...

Stop that nonsense, Kiki! They won’t take you
seriously with that attitude!

You’re the ex-Champion of the League Club,
so have some pride, will you?
Oh, uh... It’s no big deal...
episode_event_ch0357_00_suguri/6801_1001:
You already know all the spots on Pasio
’cause you keep going on ahead alone!

You snooze, you lose! It’s not my fault you’re
so slow, Kiki!

Just wait and see—I’m gonna find all the
cool spots that even you don’t know about!
episode_event_ch0357_00_suguri/4002_1001:
You might have already heard from
Lacey, but...

Blueberry Academy’s League Club has the
BB League—a system that ranks you by how
strong you are!

They even have an Elite Four and a
Champion!

As a matter of fact, Lacey is one of the
BB League Elite Four!
Wow!

If Lacey’s in the Elite Four, she must be
really strong.

And the person at the BB League’s top must
have been...
That’s right—Kieran! Cool, right?
But Juliana’s the BB League Champion now.

When she was an exchange student at
Blueberry Academy, I totally lost to her.

How about you, Carmine? Do you have any
titles of your own?
No way.

I was too busy with extracurricular stuff!
Didn’t have time for League matches.

But if we’re talking actual skill, I’m WAY
above any of the Elite Four!
Really?
What’s with that look?! You think I’m lying?

Well, since we’re all here, why don’t we
have a three-on-three team battle?
A friendly match between schools, huh?
episode_event_ch0357_00_suguri/4002_0402:
Yeah, I’m sure we’ll work together in the
future anyway.
episode_event_ch0357_00_suguri/4002_1001:
After all, Pokémon battles are a shortcut to
becoming friends!
Heh... Friends, huh...

You wanna battle us on your home turf?
OK, bring it on!

I’ll show you how strong I am—and teach
you a lesson!
episode_event_ch0357_00_suguri/4003_1001: ...Fine, I guess you pass. Barely.

I would’ve crushed you if I could Terastallize
on this island, too.
Well, that’s a possibility!
You might be able to Terastallize here!
Professor Bellis! Lear!

You all know how we can Mega Evolve and
Dynamax with the power of sync stones?

Well in the same way, you now might be
able to Terastallize, too!

But you can only Terastallize under special
circumstances!
Bingo!

You might be able to Terastallize if you use
sync stones’ energy instead.

Normally, you’d need special energy and an
item called a Tera Orb.

So I borrowed a Tera Orb from a Trainer
from Paldea to research how it would react
with sync stones!

I heard you were researching this, but I
didn’t know you’d already put it to use!
In that case, why didn’t you tell me sooner?!
Wowzers! The technology on Pasio is so cool!

On Pasio, the Terastal phenomenon is called
“Sync Terastallization”!

Theoretically, we should be able to use it
already.

Sheesh! Then I should’ve used it during our
battle just now!
Hah! Go ahead and try, then!
Don’t have to tell me twice!
Huh? It’s not reacting at all!

You’re right. Even if we do what we
normally would, it’s no use.

Do we have to use a different technique
than the one we use with Tera Orbs?

Precisely! We still haven’t heard of anyone
who’s successfully Sync Terastallized.

Which is why we’re here in search of Pasio
Academy students who can help!

In that case, I’ll be the pioneer of
Sync Terastallizing!

I won’t let Juliana, Kiki, or anyone on Pasio
surpass me!

Now that that’s decided, the only thing left
for me to do is just go for it! Time to storm
Pasio Academy!
She’s really competitive...
Oh, Sis...
It seems Carmine hasn’t changed at all.

Well, if she can take the initiative and
spread the word about Sync Terastallizing,
that’d be perfect!
The rest of you better work hard to keep up!
Hmm, in that case...
I guess I’ll run after Sis for now...
Right!
episode_event_ch0357_00_suguri/4004_1001: Hmm, did they not come this way?

I guess we lost everyone... This school’s
so big...
Yo!
Oh! Hey, Blue!
What’s up, Paulo? Lookin’ for something?
Huh? Who’s this? Haven’t seen him around.
U-um... H-hello...

This is Kieran. He came here from Blueberry
Academy, and—

...So now we’re here, looking for his sister
who ran off.
S-sorry my sis has caused so much trouble...

Hahaha! That sister of yours sure seems
feisty!
Terastallizing, huh...

If I remember correctly, that makes a
Pokémon crystallize and change type, right?

If I could master that, Pokémon battles would
be so much more interesting!

I wanna do it too, but the technique is a
little different from what I’m used to with
regular Terastallizing...

You said you only just got to Pasio,
right, Kieran?

Which probably means you’re still not used
to using sync stones.
Yeah, I think you’re right...
Then I might be able to help you with them.
Hop! Wally! Show ’em what you got!
episode_event_ch0357_00_suguri/4005_1001: Gallade! Mega Evolve!
Cinderace! Dynamax!
Whoa!

That’s amazing! This is my first time seeing
either of those phenomena!

The way to bring out sync stones’ full
strength...

is to have a strong bond with Pokémon!
And for the Trainer to have a strong will!
A strong will?
Yep! For example...

that feeling of wanting to beat your rival...
and not wanting to lose!
A rival, huh...
What about Juliana? Isn’t she your rival?
Well... She’s my friend, but...

She’s way too strong, so I don’t think she’d
want someone like me as her rival...
Besides, Nemona’s already her rival.

I gotta be as strong as Nemona if I wanna
be Juliana’s rival...
Whoa there. Why so meek?
Huh?
Who cares what others think?

If you’ve got a strong desire to beat
someone and never want to lose to
them, then that’s your rival!
Even if you’ve never beaten them!
Really? Even if it’s someone you look up to?
My rival is also a Trainer I look up to.
But if you can’t help but worry...

why don’t you just ask Juliana to be
your rival?

Yeah! Besides, competing doesn’t always
have to be about strength in battle!

For example, there’s also Pokémon
knowledge...

and how well you can hype up the crowd in
stadium battles and contests!

If there’s anything you’re better at than your
rival, then you have every reason to be
confident!
Something I’m better at than Juliana...

You could make it your goal to Sync
Terastallize before Juliana. How about that?

And once you gain more confidence, you
might feel OK calling her your rival, right?
Yeah...
Not everything should be about winning.

It’s probably good to have a rival—someone
you can compete against and grow stronger
with.
Thanks, everyone. I...
I’m gonna be Juliana’s rival! I got this!

Awesome! Then let’s start training so you
can Sync Terastallize!
episode_event_ch0357_00_suguri/4006_1001: Oh! There you are!
Huh? Did you follow me here?
Hah. Then it’s too little, too late!
I can Sync Terastallize now!
What?! Really?
I kind of just figured it out while battling her!

The moment her Pokémon started to sparkle,
I felt a difference in their attacks!
So intriguing!
I’m SUCH a genius!

I can’t believe you were able to Sync
Terastallize for the first time against a Hoenn
Elite Four member!

I guess you truly are amazing, Carmine!
I kinda respect you now!

Hah! I like your honesty. Go on—respect me
even more!
Uh-huh, got it.
Sorry. My friend is calling me. I need to go.
Huh? But no one else is here...
What? Can you see ghosts or something?
Hmm. Yeah, I guess so?
Haha! You’re pretty interesting!
Well, see you!

OK. I should go show Juliana and Kiki what I
just did right away.
I’m sure everyone will be super surprised!
What’s wrong?
Um...

Earlier you said Pokémon battles are a
shortcut to making friends, right?
Hm? Yeah, I did.
If you’re willing to be friends with Kiki...
could you look after him awhile?
Sure, but...why?

I’m only gonna tell you ’cause you seem like
a genuine person, but...

there was a time Kiki caused a lot of trouble
’cause he got so carried away trying to win.

So if he ever seems stressed about
something, could you lend him an ear?
Oh, is that it? Of course I will!

Besides, [Name:PlayerNickname ], Paulo,
and everyone else on Pasio are here for
him, too!
OK. That’s a relief.

I’m surprised you truly care about your
brother!
Huh?! What do you mean?

Hmm... Something about this feels
so familiar.

Oh, I know. You sort of remind me of my
friend who’s kind of an idiot!
Wha—?! What are you trying to say, huh?
episode_event_ch0357_00_suguri/4007_1001:
Bummer. I couldn’t grasp the technique
after all.

Heh... I don’t think I’ve ever seen Juliana
make that face.

Hah! I like that look—keep being
disappointed!
If you’d like, could you maybe be...my rival?
Your rival? After all this time?

That reminds me, you asked me something
similar before, didn’t you?

Could we start over from zero and be
friends again?

I’ve always considered you my rival—not
just my friend!

Hey! Could you teach me more about
Sync Terastallizing?
